00051 /* The frontend name (client name) as seen by other MIDAS clients   */
00052    char *frontend_name = "fevme";
00053 /* The frontend file name, don't change it */
00054    char *frontend_file_name = __FILE__;
00055 
00056 /* frontend_loop is called periodically if this variable is TRUE    */
00057    BOOL frontend_call_loop = FALSE;
00058 
00059 /* a frontend status page is displayed with this frequency in ms */
00060    INT display_period = 000;
00061

00066    INT max_event_size_frag = 1024*1024;

00086 /*-- Equipment list ------------------------------------------------*/
00087 
00088   EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00089 
00090     {"Trigger",               /* equipment name */
00091      {1, TRIGGER_ALL,         /* event ID, trigger mask */
00092       "SYSTEM",               /* event buffer */
00093       EQ_POLLED,              /* equipment type */
00094       LAM_SOURCE(0, 0xFFFFFF),                      /* event source */
00095       "MIDAS",                /* format */
00096       TRUE,                   /* enabled */
00097       RO_RUNNING,             /* read only when running */
00098 
00099       500,                    /* poll for 500ms */
00100       0,                      /* stop run after this event limit */
00101       0,                      /* number of sub events */
00102       0,                      /* don't log history */
00103       "", "", "",}
00104      ,
00105      read_event,      /* readout routine */
00106      NULL, NULL,
00107      NULL,       /* bank list */
00108     }
00109     ,
00110 
00111     {""}
00112   };

00117 /********************************************************************\
00118               Callback routines for system transitions
00119 
00120   These routines are called whenever a system transition like start/
00121   stop of a run occurs. The routines are called on the following
00122   occations:
00123 
00124   frontend_init:  When the frontend program is started. This routine
00125                   should initialize the hardware.
00126 
00127   frontend_exit:  When the frontend program is shut down. Can be used
00128                   to releas any locked resources like memory, commu-
00129                   nications ports etc.
00130 
00131   begin_of_run:   When a new run is started. Clear scalers, open
00132                   rungates, etc.
00133 
00134   end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run. Can send
00135                   end-of-run event and close run gates.
00136 
00137   pause_run:      When a run is paused. Should disable trigger events.
00138 
00139   resume_run:     When a run is resumed. Should enable trigger events.
00140 \********************************************************************/
00141 
00142 MVME_INTERFACE *gVme = 0;
00143 
00144 int gVmeioBase = 0x780000;
00145 int gAdcBase   = 0x110000;
00146 int gDisBase[] = { 0xE00000, 0 };
00147 int gTdcBase   = 0xf10000;
00148 int gVF48base  = 0xa00000;
00149 
00150 int mvme_read16(int addr)
00151 {
00152   mvme_set_dmode(gVme, MVME_DMODE_D16);
00153   return mvme_read_value(gVme, addr);
00154 }
00155 
00156 int mvme_read32(int addr)
00157 {
00158   mvme_set_dmode(gVme, MVME_DMODE_D32);
00159   return mvme_read_value(gVme, addr);
00160 }
00161 
00162 void encodeU32(char*pdata,uint32_t value)
00163 {
00164   pdata[0] = (value&0x000000FF)>>0;
00165   pdata[1] = (value&0x0000FF00)>>8;
00166   pdata[2] = (value&0x00FF0000)>>16;
00167   pdata[3] = (value&0xFF000000)>>24;
00168 }
00169 
00170 uint32_t odbReadUint32(const char*name,int index,uint32_t defaultValue = 0)
00171 {
00172   int status;
00173   uint32_t value = 0;
00174   int size = 4;
00175   HNDLE hkey;
00176   status = db_get_data_index(hDB,hkey,&value,&size,index,TID_DWORD);
00177   if (status != SUCCESS)
00178     {
00179       cm_msg (MERROR,frontend_name,"Cannot read \'%s\'[%d] from odb, status %d",name,index,status);
00180       return defaultValue;
00181     }
00182   return value;
00183 }
00184 
00185 int enable_trigger()
00186 {
00187 #ifdef HAVE_VMEIO
00188   vmeio_OutputSet(gVme,gVmeioBase,0xFFFF);
00189 #endif
00190   return 0;
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 int disable_trigger()
00195 {
00196 #ifdef HAVE_VMEIO
00197   vmeio_OutputSet(gVme,gVmeioBase,0);
00198 #endif
00199   return 0;
00200 }
00201 
00202 INT init_vme_modules()
00203 {
00204 #ifdef HAVE_VMEIO
00205   vmeio_OutputSet(gVme,gVmeioBase,0);
00206   vmeio_StrobeClear(gVme,gVmeioBase);
00207   printf("VMEIO at 0x%x CSR is 0x%x\n",gVmeioBase,vmeio_CsrRead(gVme,gVmeioBase));
00208 #endif
00209 
00210 #ifdef HAVE_V792
00211   v792_SingleShotReset(gVme,gAdcBase);
00212   v792_Status(gVme,gAdcBase);
00213 #endif
00214 
00215 #ifdef HAVE_V895
00216   for (int i=0; gDisBase[i] != 0; i++)
00217     {
00218       v895_Status(gVme,gDisBase[i]);
00219 
00220       v895_writeReg16(gVme,gDisBase[i],0x40,255); // width 0-7
00221       v895_writeReg16(gVme,gDisBase[i],0x42,255); // width 8-15
00222       v895_writeReg16(gVme,gDisBase[i],0x48,56); // majority
00223       v895_writeReg16(gVme,gDisBase[i],0x4A,0xFFFF); // enable all channels
00224       //v895_writeReg8(gVme,gDisBase[i],0x4A,0x0000); // enable all channels
00225       for (int j=0; j<16; j++)
00226   {
00227     int thr_mV = 12;
00228     v895_writeReg16(gVme,gDisBase[i],j*2,thr_mV); // threshold in mV
00229   }
00230       //v895_TestPulse(gVme,gDisBase[i]); // fire test pulse
00231 
00232       //v895_writeReg16(gVme,gDisBase[i],0*2,250); // threshold in mV
00233     }
00234 #endif
00235 
00236 #ifdef HAVE_V1190B
00237   v1190_SoftClear(gVme,gTdcBase);
00238   v1190_Status(gVme,gTdcBase);
00239 #endif
00240 
00241 #ifdef HAVE_VF48
00242   VF48_Reset(gVme,gVF48base);
00243   printf("VF48 at 0x%x CSR is 0x%x\n",gVF48base,VF48_CsrRead(gVme,gVF48base));
00244 #endif
00245 
00246   return SUCCESS;
00247 }
00248 
00249 /*-- Frontend Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00250 
00251 INT frontend_init()
00252 {
00253   int status;
00254 
00255   setbuf(stdout,NULL);
00256   setbuf(stderr,NULL);
00257 
00258   status = mvme_open(&gVme,0);
00259   status = mvme_set_am(gVme, MVME_AM_A24_ND);
00260 
00261   init_vme_modules();
00262 
00263   disable_trigger();
00264 
00265   return status;
00266 }
00267 
00268 static int gHaveRun = 0;
00269 
00270 /*-- Frontend Exit -------------------------------------------------*/
00271 
00272 INT frontend_exit()
00273 {
00274   gHaveRun = 0;
00275   disable_trigger();
00276 
00277   mvme_close(gVme);
00278 
00279   return SUCCESS;
00280 }
00281 
00282 /*-- Begin of Run --------------------------------------------------*/
00283 
00284 INT begin_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00285 {
00286   gHaveRun = 1;
00287   printf("begin run %d\n",run_number);
00288 
00289   init_vme_modules();
00290 
00291   enable_trigger();
00292   return SUCCESS;
00293 }
00294 
00295 /*-- End of Run ----------------------------------------------------*/
00296 INT end_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00297 {
00298   static bool gInsideEndRun = false;
00299 
00300   if (gInsideEndRun)
00301     {
00302       printf("breaking recursive end_of_run()\n");
00303       return SUCCESS;
00304     }
00305 
00306   gInsideEndRun = true;
00307 
00308   gHaveRun = 0;
00309   printf("end run %d\n",run_number);
00310   disable_trigger();
00311 
00312   gInsideEndRun = false;
00313 
00314   return SUCCESS;
00315 }
00316 
00317 /*-- Pause Run -----------------------------------------------------*/
00318 INT pause_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00319 {
00320   gHaveRun = 0;
00321   disable_trigger();
00322   return SUCCESS;
00323 }
00324 
00325 /*-- Resume Run ----------------------------------------------------*/
00326 INT resume_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00327 {
00328   gHaveRun = 1;
00329   enable_trigger();
00330   return SUCCESS;
00331 }
00332 
00333 /*-- Frontend Loop -------------------------------------------------*/
00334 INT frontend_loop()
00335 {
00336   /* if frontend_call_loop is true, this routine gets called when
00337      the frontend is idle or once between every event */
00338   return SUCCESS;
00339 }

00347 /*-- Trigger event routines ----------------------------------------*/
00348 extern "C" INT poll_event(INT source, INT count, BOOL test)
00349 /* Polling routine for events. Returns TRUE if event
00350    is available. If test equals TRUE, don't return. The test
00351    flag is used to time the polling */
00352 {
00353   //printf("poll_event %d %d %d!\n",source,count,test);
00354 
00355   for (int i=0 ; i<count ; i++)
00356   {
00357     int lam = v792_DataReady(gVme,gAdcBase);
00358     //printf("source: 0x%x, lam: 0x%x\n", source, lam);
00359 
00360     if (lam)
00361       if (!test)
00362         return TRUE;
00363   }
00364 
00365   return FALSE;
00366 
00367 #if 0
00368   for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
00369     {
00370       usleep(1000);
00371       if (true)
00372   if (!test)
00373     return v792_DataReady(gVme,gAdcBase);
00374     }
00375   return 1;
00376 
00377   return v792_DataReady(gVme,gAdcBase);
00378 #endif
00379 }
00380 
00381 /*-- Interrupt configuration ---------------------------------------*/
00382 extern "C" INT interrupt_configure(INT cmd, INT source, PTYPE adr)
00383 {
00384    switch (cmd) {
00385    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00386      break;
00387    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00388      break;
00389    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH:
00390      break;
00391    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH:
00392      break;
00393    }
00394    return SUCCESS;
00395 }
00396 
00397 /*-- Event readout -------------------------------------------------*/
00398 
00399 int read_v792(int base,const char*bname,char*pevent,int nchan)
00400 {
00401   int i;
00402   int wcount = 0;
00403   DWORD data[100];
00404   int counter = 0;
00405   WORD* pdata;
00406 
00407   /* Event counter */
00408   v792_EvtCntRead(gVme, base, &counter);
00409 
00410   /* Read Event */
00411   v792_EventRead(gVme, base, data, &wcount);
00412 
00413   /* create ADCS bank */
00414   bk_create(pevent, bname, TID_WORD, &pdata);
00415 
00416   for (i=0; i<32; i++)
00417     pdata[i] = 0;
00418 
00419   for (i=0; i<wcount; i++)
00420     {
00421       uint32_t w = data[i];
00422       if (((w>>24)&0x7) != 0) continue;
00423       int chan = (w>>16)&0x1F;
00424       int val  = (w&0x1FFF);
00425       pdata[chan] = val;
00426     }
00427 
00428   //printf("counter %6d, words: %3d, header: 0x%08x, ADC0: 0x%08x, ADC0,1,2: %6d %6d %6d\n",counter,wcount,data[0],pdata[0],pdata[0],pdata[1],pdata[2]);
00429 
00430   pdata += nchan;
00431   bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00432 
00433   return wcount;
00434 }
00435 
00436 #ifdef HAVE_V1190B
00437 int read_tdc(int base,char*pevent)
00438 {
00439   int time0 = 0;
00440   int time1 = 0;
00441   int time2 = 0;
00442   int count;
00443   const int kDataSize = 10000;
00444   DWORD data[kDataSize];
00445   int* pdata32;
00446 
00447   /* create TOPA bank */
00448   bk_create(pevent, "TDCS", TID_INT, &pdata32);
00449 
00450   //while (count <
00451   count = v1190_DataRead(gVme, base, data, 10000);
00452 
00453   if (count > 0)
00454     {
00455 #if 0
00456       if (count > 1000)
00457   printf("reading TDC got %d words\n",count);
00458 
00459       printf("reading TDC got %d words\n",count);
00460 #endif
00461       for (int i=0; i<count; i++)
00462   {
00463     int code = 0x1F&(data[i]>>27);
00464 
00465     if (data[i] == 0)
00466       continue;
00467 
00468     switch (code)
00469       {
00470       case 0:
00471         {
00472     int edge = 0x1&(data[i]>>26);
00473     int chan = 0x3F&(data[i]>>19);
00474     int time = 0x3FFFF&data[i];
00475 #if 0
00476     printf("tdc %3d: 0x%08x, code 0x%02x, edge %d, chan %2d, time %6d\n",
00477            i,
00478            data[i],
00479            code,
00480            edge,
00481            chan,
00482            time);
00483 #endif
00484     if ((chan==0) && (time0==0))
00485       time0 = time;
00486     if ((chan==1) && (time0!=0) && (time1==0) && (time>time0))
00487       time1 = time;
00488     if ((chan==2) && (time0!=0) && (time2==0) && (time>time0))
00489       time2 = time;
00490         }
00491         break;
00492         //case 0x18:
00493     //break;
00494       default:
00495 #if 0
00496         printf("tdc %3d: 0x%08x, code 0x%02x\n",i,data[i],code);
00497 #endif
00498         break;
00499       }
00500   }
00501 
00502 #if 0
00503       if (time1 && time2)
00504   printf("time %8d %8d %8d, diff %8d\n",time0,time1,time2,time1-time2);
00505 #endif
00506     }
00507 
00508   int xdata = time1-time2;
00509   if (xdata < -10000)
00510     xdata = 0;
00511   else if (xdata > 10000)
00512     xdata = 0;
00513 
00514 #if 0
00515   if (xdata == 0)
00516     printf("count %d, time %8d %8d %8d, diff %8d\n",count,time0,time1,time2,xdata);
00517 #endif
00518 
00519   *pdata32++ = xdata;
00520 
00521   bk_close(pevent, pdata32);
00522 
00523   v1190_SoftClear(gVme,base);
00524 
00525   return 0;
00526 }
00527 #endif
00528 
00529 #ifdef HAVE_VF48
00530 int read_vf48(int base,char* pevent)
00531 {
00532   int count = 0xF;
00533   DWORD buf[10000];
00534   int* pdata32;
00535 
00536   /* create TOPA bank */
00537   bk_create(pevent, "VF48", TID_INT, &pdata32);
00538 
00539   VF48_EventRead(gVme, base, buf, &count);
00540 
00541   for (int i=0; i<count; i++)
00542     *pdata32++ = buf[i];
00543 
00544   bk_close(pevent, pdata32);
00545 
00546   return 0;
00547 }
00548 #endif
00549 
00550 INT read_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00551 {
00552   //printf("read event!\n");
00553 
00554   /* init bank structure */
00555   bk_init32(pevent);
00556 
00557 #ifdef HAVE_V792
00558   read_v792(gAdcBase,"ADC1",pevent,32);
00559 #endif
00560 #ifdef HAVE_V1190B
00561   read_tdc(gTdcBase,pevent);
00562 #endif
00563 #ifdef HAVE_VF48
00564   read_vf48(gVF48base,pevent);
00565 #endif
00566 
00567   return bk_size(pevent);
00568 }
